Reviews.Title: easy features
Reviews.Author: L. Thompson
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my 70+ mom's first Europe trip.  She never used a digital before so I wanted one with easy features, and this one is it.The camera's on screen tutorial is a great help, and the manual is easy to understand.  The screen and fonts are large enough to see clearly. Her favorite feature is the AUTO MODE, just point and shoot. I made sure to give her plenty of extra AA batteries, as it does not come with a charger. USB cables provided allow easy hook up to computer. Best price I found was on Amazon.  Thanks!

Reviews.Title: excelent buy
Reviews.Author: Juan M. Castro "JMC"
Reviews.Content: the quality of the pics are decent, the camera performs fairly well under low light conditions, which is a good thing.  I was looking for a AA battery camera, and SD memory slot, and this is the best camera I could find with those two coniditons for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use and value for money
Reviews.Author: Santosh K. Behera "San"
Reviews.Content: I wanted a camera that was easy to use, lightweight and has the basic features for everyday use.This was perfect with easily navigable menu, most common shooting modes that one is likely to encounter and the best part was the price. Its definitely one of the best at this price!I have used it for both indoor and outdoor shooting and the pictures have come out perfect. I don't like to use the flash at all as I do not like to disturb say a group of people in a party by the blinding flash and also I prefer the natural light, and this does a very good job of it.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Extreme
Reviews.Author: Richard F. Patterson "Teddy Bear"
Reviews.Content: I have never been more pleased with a Nikon camera as I have been with the CoolPix L19. It's a very easy camera to get used to.I am a novice,so I'm sure there are a lot of good cameras out there but being my third camera I am delighted with this one. Thanks Nikon.

Reviews.Title: wonderful point and shoot
Reviews.Author: JSpeth3419
Reviews.Content: While I have only had the camera a few days, I wanted to take a time out to show my satisfaction for this product. This is a fantastic point and shoot camera! It's not the high tech sophisticated camera for the more experienced people interested in photography, but it is a quality product. I read the manual and found out all the little in and outs and special features for this camera and there were a great many! I spent most of a day testing out the different settings and taking photos. The quality of the pictures was fantastic, the camera was easy to use and I could not be happier with my purchase!

Reviews.Title: Excellent little camera
Reviews.Author: Mary L. Martin "MaryM"
Reviews.Content: So far I love this little camera and I still haven't learned all the functions.  Easy to use, takes great pictures and small movies.  Screen is larger than the kodak digital camera I have which I find very helpful.Only con: The recommended case (leather)I ordered, for an extra $4 was too small for the camera.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix L19
Reviews.Author: C. C. Baelz
Reviews.Content: camera is a great starter camera for digital dummies. works fine, love the auto smile shoot feature.

Reviews.Title: Handy coolpix
Reviews.Author: A. Shrestha "Cool Man"
Reviews.Content: I have always been a Nikon fan. This is the latest one i bought for my mother in law. Its compact but easy to use, different scene modes, edit pictures, perfect for first time users . I would have preferred to get a rechargeable battery with the set but its been a really great gift for her.

Reviews.Title: I wish I'd found this a year ago!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: For under $100, I believe this is the best camera you can get. I bought it replace a horrible camera that I'd had for about a year. I only paid a few dollars more for this one and it's twice the camera.It's easy to use and takes wonderful photos even in auto mode. It also has many different settings and adjustments to get the perfect photo every time. In addition to taking beautiful photos, the L19 takes great video with sound, the quality is as good if not better than the flip camcorders.I was a little concerned about batterie life when I first recieved it, the included batteries only lasted a day but I replaced them with better ones and they've lasted well.As a long time fan of the Nikon brand, I feel this is a worthy addition to their product line. I would highly recommend it to anyone that is just starting out with digital photography or wants a fairly small and easy camera to shoot quick snapshots.

Reviews.Title: Nikon L19 Camera
Reviews.Author: James W. Rogers "Jim Rogers"
Reviews.Content: A lot is packed into this small camera, especially for the price.  Very satisfied with this product and its well worth it.

Reviews.Title: Not very durable!
Reviews.Author: M. Ollette "fsufans"
Reviews.Content: Takes great pictures.  But the slightest little mishap will cause a "lens error" and the repair costs as much or more than the camera. After owning it for 7 mos., it was on a dresser, @ 3 ft off the ground, and fell onto a carpeted bedroom floor.  Never worked again. Several people online experienced the same problem.  Nikon won't cover it under warranty either.  Needless to say, my replacement camera will not be a Nikon

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Lynn Stark
Reviews.Content: This camera replaced a 35 mm camera. I love this camera. I followed the online advice and use lithium batteries. The camera has been in use for two months and I have taken at least 500 pictures and many movies. The camera lets you take a 25 minute video, which came in handy at Lowes motor speedway. I purchased a 4 GB memory card, which allows me to take about 1500 pictures. Resolution is great and the 2.7 inch screen makes it easy to snap. I recommend this camera to everyone.

Reviews.Title: COOLPIX L-19 OK
Reviews.Author: Edd "Docmonack"
Reviews.Content: The L-19 is a capable little camera. Occasionally I have to supply pix with the copy I write and use Nikon cameras' exclusively. With the 8mp, one can actuallyprint an 8x10 and have it NOT look ridiculous. The new lcd screen is twice as large as previous models and the software is very user friendly. As long as you are NOT paying $200 for it, it's a great little shooter. I just spent 5 days in the desert with it and it held up just fine.- EM

Reviews.Title: Poor picture quality
Reviews.Author: E Pluribus Unum
Reviews.Content: I rarely write negative reviews, but this camera has driven my wife and me nuts. We have two young daughters, so we wanted to have a reliable, easy-to-use camera to follow them as they grow up. This camera is AWFUL! The picture quality is horrendous -- we have to take four or five shots just to get one that is somewhat clear. It often sticks so that you can't take the picture immediately. We called Nikon and they claimed it was our memory drive. We changed drives, and it still takes poor pictures. Enough! We are getting a different camera.

Reviews.Title: What a terrific camera
Reviews.Author: K. A. Holland
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a birthday gift for my husband. This camera is easy to use and takes beautiful pictures. We took it on vacation with us in July and it worked out great. Very easy to transfer photographs to the computer.

Reviews.Title: A very good camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Craig S. Coker
Reviews.Content: I have a SLR digital but it's too bulky to travel with often.  I bought the Coolpix as it fits into my laptop bag and it's right at my fingertips.  It's easy to use, although it's worth taking the time to study the user guide carefully.  Uploading pictures to the PC is easy.  All in all, a very good buy.

Reviews.Title: GOOD CAMERA FOR THE PRICE
Reviews.Author: Carlos J. Salazar Figueredo
Reviews.Content: good camera forthe price, esay to use, the only thing I would like to have is an audio & video cable.

Reviews.Title: CoolPix Getting Close to Idiot Proof
Reviews.Author: D. Witham
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my wife's birthday because she wanted a small camera that did not take an engineer to setup and was truly point-and-shoot. This is very good in that department if you have time to figure out what all the mode icons mean. It takes a good bit of understanding to pickout and select the mode that is the best compromise of all that you want to shoot but once done it becomes a truly easy to use Point-and-Shoot with Nikon's trademark high quality images. The icon guessing game is truly a challenge with this one.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality pictures
Reviews.Author: Dawn "Dawn"
Reviews.Content: I returned this camera because the picture quality was poor. Pictures were bright red despite the adjustment. Could be that this particular camera is just a bad one. Amazon refunded me without any questions asked. I will search dor another brand.

Reviews.Title: Survived the washing machine!
Reviews.Author: julie lanoie
Reviews.Content: I purchased our first L19 three years ago for my grandfather, who was 94 at the time. With the onset of dementia, his lifelong hobby of photography and home-movie making was becoming a major challenge for him (couldn't remember how to load film, how to transfer media, etc).  I wanted a digital with a very easy user menu that I could set on "auto" mode so that he could maintain as much independence as possible with his photography without getting frustrated by new technology. He mastered the camera in one afternoon (which was a big deal, as other tasks, like using a basic telephone, were too complicated). The camera is used every day, has been dropped, left in the driveway overnight, and stepped on a few times. I had to replace it with an identical L19 when he broke the door that holds the batteries (the camera still worked with a small piece of duct tape holding the door closed, but he wouldn't stop fiddling with the tape and the batteries kept falling out, so I inherited the first one and got him a second.)  It went through the washing machine accidentally last weekend. We did not have high hopes for recovery and I was preparing to order a THIRD, but after letting it dry out for a few days, we turned it on, and miraculously, it worked perfectly!!!Pros:1. This camera is very easy to use, even for someone new to digital, and in our case, someone with moderate dementia. The menu is intuitive. I imagine that it would also made a great first camera for kids.2. Photo quality is decent. We've captured some great shots that have enlarged well. For household use, (thousands of pictures of flowers, dogs, and people eating) this camera is great.3. It did survive the washing machine with a full load.Cons:1. It requires the more expensive batteries designed for high-end digital electronics (ie: "ultimate lithium"). It wouldn't work properly with regular AA's; it would take just a few photos before saying that the battery was exhausted. With daily use, we change them every ten-fourteen days, but this is not a deterrent for us as a user-friendly camera and some independent activity is worth the investment.All in all, a great camera for my grandfather who is 97 now and still using it every single day. He is taking a picture of me right now as I write this review...

Reviews.Title: Love it but I broke the battery-"door"
Reviews.Author: Cami Waldeck
Reviews.Content: I ABSOLUTELY LOVE this simple camera.  I have gone through at least 10 digital cameras in the past 2 years (all were stolen or broken purposefully by a*holes...)  and now I have 2 digital cameras plus the one on my Blackberry... recording equipment of any kind is like a weapon I use, instead of real weapons...  (Nikon Coolpix L19 and  a Canon 10.1, very similar to the Nikon but actually I like the Nikon better. They are around the same price/look.)I love this camera so much and USE it so much that I am willing to TAPE the darn battery-door shut to make it work... I know the latch can be fixed somehow but I don't have $ to fix it and when I do get $, I am robed.  I know, the world IS out to get me.  But I'm be out to get the world really soon.The ironic thing is, the latch that keeps the memory card in my Canon does not work, but the latch that keeps the battery/mem. card area closed does work... the mem. cards stay in my Nikon fine.Anyhow, I love the video ability of the Nikon and its ease of use with everything else.  I DO like the AA battery vs. lithium battery; I lose the lithium batteries and they cost my too much to replace.  I WOULD sell my Nikon for a very inexpensive rate if I could buy a new one exactly the same; or I'd barter it out along with whatever, for a new, unopened perfect Nikon CoolpixL19 8MP.  Anyone interested, email me at [...]

Reviews.Title: camera was defective & it cost $18.45 to return it.
Reviews.Author: K. Dost "salukikaren"
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a simple digital camera for my mother who has had a stroke and read reviews of this Nikon that said it was simple to use. When I got the camera and tested it, the LCD display was so grainy I could hardly see anything, the zoom was sticky, and the auto focus was not working. I have two Nikons that I love so was so disapointed. I got free shipping so to return it, I had to pay the original shipping of $9 plus another $9.45 to send it back. I probably will not buy anything else from Amazon because of this extra expense.

Reviews.Title: Battery hog
Reviews.Author: episcocrank
Reviews.Content: Six months ago I bought this as a snapshooter, and that's about what it is. The size is handy and the controls are easy to understand and use. But the picture quality is nowhere near as sharp as I expected and some of the colors in the images can be over-the-top bright. The most infuriating thing is the battery life. Using good quality alkaline AA batteries, I'm lucky if I can get 50-60 pictures. If I take the batteries out between uses I can sometimes stretch it to 75 or 80. Would not buy this camera again.

Reviews.Title: Poor Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: Mr. C
Reviews.Content: Although relatively inexpensive, I expected better picture quality from a Nikon 8MP camera. All of the photos I took in less-than-bright light are slightly blurred and grainy. I would not recommend this camera for any reason.

Reviews.Title: Another One Bites the Dust
Reviews.Author: Mother of 3
Reviews.Content: This is the second digital camera I have bought through Amazon and the second one to break after a few months.  This one was in a soft sleeve in my coat pocket.  I brought it out to take a picture of my kids and the screen was ruined, completely useless.  Prior to breaking, I wasn't all that thrilled with the camera.  There is a delay in the shooting which leads it to the camera constantly asking "did someone blink?"  Why yes, because little kids can't hold still and smile for very long.  I didn't find this all that easy to use.  So, I've been through a Cannon and now this Nikon.  Both broke. However, I need a camera to record my children's lives. These digital cameras are quickly becoming very expensive disposables.

Reviews.Title: Good value
Reviews.Author: Newly Wed
Reviews.Content: Purchased as a gift to replace step-daughter's Sony which lasted for 5 years.  She takes a great quantity of pictures and complained about it not having a retractable, automatic lens cover and coming without a case.  Also  says batteries don't last long enough in comparison to her original Sony camera.  Please don't let this disuade you from purchasing the camera because I'm sure her disliking it had more to do with the price tag than anything else (not expensive = not worthy in her world).  Her father thought it was a great value and it's definitely nicer than ours!

Reviews.Title: Good!
Reviews.Author: Rhonaly G.
Reviews.Content: good customer service. There was a lot of scratches. When i use the zoom/focus, the camera sometimes froze up and sometimes doesn't go back to unfocus. though i bought the used.The old one I have that was brand new is awesome, sadly i dropped it and the lock broke so it won't close, but still works great!

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix L19 Digital camers
Reviews.Author: J D'Silva
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for about two years and have had no problems.  Photography is not my hobby and I use it on occasion and on holidays.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Cami
Reviews.Content: I bought this a few years ago and the color quality is amazing for such an inexpensive camera.  Warm color tones.  The settings are also really good to catch many different types of shots.  The video is excellent, I think, compared to most other little cameras.  it may not be the smallest thing, but I prefer AA batteries. I used this camera up and I just ordered a new one!

Reviews.Title: Update 7/22/2013
Reviews.Author: Lucy B.
Reviews.Content: Wanted to update my review of this camera. After 4 yrs. of owning it, it froze out of the blue and would not work. Lens would not expand, camera would not turn on. I would like to think that a camera would last a bit longer, so buyer beware.

Reviews.Title: A very nice little camera
Reviews.Author: David Scoggins
Reviews.Content: I bought this as my first point and shoot camera- ANikon -19 and am very happy with it! Very easy to use and the 2-aa batteries for me works best!! Verygood quality pics!!!

Reviews.Title: Lens jammed
Reviews.Author: Patricia McCallister
Reviews.Content: Worked okay for about a year and a half until the lens jammed after switching from wide angle to telephoto.  This camera was a 2007 generation Coolpix 5.1 mp 3x zoom.  From other comments here, it appears that Nikon hasn't addressed this problem

Reviews.Title: bad picture quality
Reviews.Author: Khanh Do
Reviews.Content: I don't recommend this camera to anyone, even with a low price, it's not worth it. Though it comes with a 8 megapixel sensor, the picture quality is bad most of the time. I'm a regular DSLR user so I would say I know how to take photo, but with this camera it does not give me good photo, doesn't matter how and what I tried. Yes it's cheap, it looks cute and portable with the AA battery, but the picture quality is very questionable, under any lighting condition. I strongly suggest anyone to look for something cheap but reliable to stay away from this one, and get something in a bit higher price range for better quality.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: M. O'Donnell
Reviews.Content: I like this easy to use camera - if I can use it anyone can!  Why not give it a try?

Reviews.Title: Bad pictures
Reviews.Author: swift
Reviews.Content: The camera itself is not a very good one. The pictures are a little fuzzy if you don't have the perfect lighting and don't hold it correctly and it's slow on the shutter button.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera.
Reviews.Author: S. Orr
Reviews.Content: Had it for a couple years.  Battery life is good.  Get rechargeable batteries.  Takes great pictures.  Saves pictures reasonably fast.

Reviews.Title: No near the camera as the P50 Nikon
Reviews.Author: Rex Morris
Reviews.Content: First of all I will talk about the camera, then about the POOR and irresponsible manner in which my order was filled. I had bought another Nikon camera a few months previous. It was a P50. I could not keep my Wife's hands off of it, so I bought here the L19. The functionality of the L19 seem okay. It just does not have the feel or the P50. Secondly, the picture quality of the L19 does not live up to that of the P50. It has disappointed us both. Finally, When I purchased the camera, it was part of a package that contained the camera, a memory card and a costly leather case. The leather case was designed for a much smaller camera. Why would they include that as part of a package? I tried various means to communicatethis problem, but was never answered. I'm still waiting. Rex

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera at a good price
Reviews.Author: Mg Gallegos13 "taxed with books"
Reviews.Content: I gave this as a gift to a friend in Paraguay and she loves it.

ProductInfo.Features:
8.0-megapixel resolution for photo-quality prints up to 16 x 20 inches
3.6x optical Zoom-Nikkor glass lens
2.7-inch high-resolution LCD screen
Nikon's Smart Portrait System; Red-eye Fix, Face Priority AE and more
Capture images to SD/SDHC memory cards (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Nikon Coolpix L19 8MP Digital Camera with 3.6 Optical Zoom and 2.7 inch LCD (Silver)
